Steam (ST): In the cathedral devoid of people, ...a figure could be seen still staring up at the heavens, its chest pierced with a long red sword that pinned it in place to the ground. That figure was...Battler.
Umineko Project (UP): In the cathedral devoid of people, .........a figure could be seen still staring up at the heavens, its chest pierced with a long red sword which pinned it in place to the ground. ......It was the figure of Battler.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the cathedral devoid of people, .........a figure could be seen still staring up at the heavens, its chest pierced with a long red sword which pinned it in place to the ground......the figure of Battler.
PC Japanese (JP): 誰もいない大聖堂に、………天を見上げた姿のまま、赤き太刀に胸を貫かれ、地面に縫い止められた戦人が、……立ち尽くしている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 誰もいない大聖堂に、………天を見上げた姿のまま、赤き太刀に胸を貫かれ、地面に縫い止められた戦人が、……立ち尽くしている。
Russian (RU): В безлюдном соборе......... виднелась фигура, по‐прежнему глядящая в небеса и пронзённая в грудь длинным красным мечом, приковавшим её к полу...... Фигура Баттлера.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na catedral inabitada, .........podia ser vista uma silhueta que continuava a olhar para os céus, com seu peito perfurado por um montante vermelho que se fincava ao chão. ......Imóvel ele permanecera ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在無人的大聖堂中，………保持著仰望上天的姿勢，被紅色戰刀貫穿胸口，釘在地面上的戰人，……一動不動地站在那裡。

Steam (ST): ...Ironically, it looked just like what he'd done to Beato with blue wedges in the 4th game...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Ironically, it looked just like what he had done to Beato with blue wedges in the fourth game......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Ironically, it looked just like what he had done to Beato with blue wedges in the 4th game......

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ironicamente, assemelhava‐se ao que ele havia feito com Beato, com suas cunhas azuis no quarto jogo......

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……讽刺的是，这副样子看起来跟他在第 4 盘游戏中，以他自己的蓝楔，所贯穿的贝阿朵一样……。

Umineko Project (UP): Battler had died quite some time ago.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Battler had died quite some time ago.

Steam (ST): ...After being defeated in a fight over the truth and surrendering, he no longer had the strength to think of a way to resist.
Umineko Project (UP): ......After being defeated in a fight over the truth, he no longer had the strength to think of a way to resist.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......After being defeated in a fight over the truth and surrendering, he no longer had the strength to think of a way to resist.

Russian (RU): Когда‐то она даже не могла пить чёрный чай по собственному желанию...... но, хоть и медленно... и с безжизненными глазами...... она, что удивительно, шла.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'd like to counter that by saying it isn't so uncommon for a rich family's mansion to have a hidden door or two built into it.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso me fez querer argumentar e dizer que não é incomum que a mansão de uma família rica tenha uma ou duas portas secretas escondidas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): “大富豪的房子造暗門什麼的，根本不稀奇吧”，真想這麼還嘴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): “大富豪的房子造暗门什么的，根本不稀奇吧”，真想这么还嘴。

Steam (ST): ...But apparently, that sort of rule works perfectly well in the mystery genre.
Umineko Project (UP): ......But apparently, you can get away with that kind of rule in the mystery genre.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But apparently, that sort of rule works perfectly well in the mystery genre.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): By the way, there exist many wonderful mysteries in which hidden doors appear, and where hidden doors are the theme.

Umineko Project (UP): Without that "premise", hidden doors mustn't exist.{n}So if that "premise" isn't there, there's no need to search for hidden doors.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If that 'premise' doesn't exist, hidden doors must not exist. So because that 'premise' doesn't exist, there is no need to search for hidden doors.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 没有这个“前提”，就不得存在暗门。{n}所以，要是没这个“前提”，那就不用搜寻暗门。

Steam (ST): ...I think that's probably the essence of her ridiculous argument.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I think that's probably the essence of her ridiculous argument.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Russian (RU): ......Думаю, вот в чём суть её нелепого аргумента.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu acredito que essa provavelmente é a essência do argumento ridículo dela.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我想这两句话，就是她所说的谬论的核心。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Credo che il succo della sua assurda tesi debba essere questo.

Steam (ST): It's like the detective trying to expose the truth...and the illusion trying to confuse it with a mixture of truth and lies... are getting blended together, leading to a bizarre form of argument similar to a Devil's Proof.
Umineko Project (UP): I get the feeling that the detective trying to expose the truth and the illusion trying to mask it with fiction...are getting blended together, leading to a bizarre form of argument similar to a Devil's Proof.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I get the feeling that the detective trying to expose the truth and the illusion trying to confuse it with a mixture of truth and lies... are getting blended together, leading to a bizarre form of argument similar to a Devil's Proof.
PC Japanese (JP): 現実を暴く探偵と、虚実で誤魔化す幻想が、ごちゃ混ぜにされて、悪魔の証明のような、おかしな論法を生み出している気がする。
Russian (RU): У меня такое чувство, что детектив, который пытается раскрыть правду, и иллюзия, запутывающая её смесью правды и лжи, смешались, что привело к странному аргументу, аналогичному доказательству дьявола.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu sinto que o detetive que está tentando expor a verdade e a ilusão que está tentando mascará‐la com a ficção...estão começando a se misturar, levando a um bizarro argumento similar a uma Prova Diabólica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 感覺這就像，揭露現實的偵探與以虛實掩飾的幻想，混合在一起，所誕生的，類似惡魔的證明的，莫名其妙的邏輯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 感觉这就像，揭露现实的侦探与以虚实掩饰的幻想，混合在一起，所诞生的，类似恶魔的证明的，莫名其妙的逻辑。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ho la sensazione che il detective alla ricerca del vero e l'illusione che cerca di nasconderlo con un miscuglio di verità e menzogne... si stiano fondendo insieme, per dar frutto ad una strana forma di argomentazione simile alla Prova del Diavolo.

Steam (ST): Making a closed room murder seem to be accomplished by a witch with magic is fantasy.
Umineko Project (UP): Making a locked‐room murder seem to be accomplished by a witch with magic—that's fantasy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Making a closed room murder seem to be accomplished by a witch with magic is fantasy.
PC Japanese (JP): 密室殺人を魔女が魔法で行なったとするのが、ファンタジー。
Russian (RU): Создание убийства в закрытой комнате, которое видится совершённым ведьмой при помощи магии — фантастика.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Fazer um assassinato de quarto fechado parecer ter sido cometido por uma bruxa usando magia — isso é fantasia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女以魔法犯下密室殺人，是幻想劇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女以魔法犯下密室杀人，是幻想剧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Far sì che un assassinio in una stanza chiusa sembri opera di una strega è fantasy.

Steam (ST): Exposing that it was a Human's crime done with tricks is anti-fantasy.
Umineko Project (UP): Exposing that it was a {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}'s crime done with tricks—that's anti‐fantasy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Exposing that it was a human's crime done with tricks is anti-fantasy.
PC Japanese (JP): それをトリックによる、ニンゲンの犯行だと暴くのが、アンチファンタジー。
Russian (RU): Выявление того, что преступление с помощью хитростей провернул {y:0:Человек}{n:0:человек} — "антифантастика".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Expor que foi um crime {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano} cometido com truques — isso é a antifantasia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 揭露“這是通過詭計辦到的，人類的犯案”，是反幻想劇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 揭露“这是通过诡计办到的，人类的犯案”，是反幻想剧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rivelare che si tratta di un crimine compiuto da un umano grazie a dei trucchi è anti-fantasy.

Steam (ST): Examining all possibilities to expose the nature of those tricks is mystery.
Umineko Project (UP): Investigating all possibilities to expose what those tricks are—that's mystery.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Considering all possibilities to expose those tricks is mystery.
PC Japanese (JP): そのトリックを暴くためにあらゆる可能性を検討するのがミステリー。
Russian (RU): Учёт всех возможностей для выявления этих хитростей — детектив.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Investigar todas as possibilidades para expor o que são esses truques — isso é o mistério.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為揭露這個詭計，探討各種各樣可能性的，是推理劇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为揭露这个诡计，探讨各种各样可能性的，是推理剧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prendere in considerazione tutte le possibilità per portare alla luce quei trucchi è mystery.

Steam (ST): But is it also mystery...to claim that possibilities with no hints supporting them are unworthy of investigation?
Umineko Project (UP): But claiming that possibilities with no hints supporting them are unworthy of investigation—that's......also mystery?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But is it also mystery......to claim that possibilities with no hints supporting them are unworthy of investigation?
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、手掛かりのない可能性は、検討にも値しないというのも、……ミステリー？
Russian (RU): Но когда утверждаешь, что возможности без намёков на них не стоят расследования...... это тоже детектив?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas alegar que possibilidades sem pistas como base são indignadas de serem investigadas — isso......também é o mistério?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，那所謂沒有線索的可能性，一點都不值得探討的，……也是推理劇？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，那所谓没有线索的可能性，一点都不值得探讨的，……也是推理剧？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma rientra nel mystery... anche l'affermare che non valga la pena indagare su possibilità prive di indizi che le supportino?

Steam (ST): Let's say a hidden door is hidden in a way that there would be no clues.
Umineko Project (UP): Hidden doors, by definition, are hidden in a way that there can't be any clues.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Let's say a hidden door is hidden in a way that there would be no clues.
PC Japanese (JP): 隠し扉は手掛かりなどあるはずもなく隠されている。
Russian (RU): Предположим, скрытый проход скрыт так, что нет никаких улик.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Portas secretas, por definição, estão escondidas de forma que não podem haver pistas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 暗門，沒有絲毫線索地隱藏著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 暗门，没有丝毫线索地隐藏着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mettiamo che un passaggio segreto sia nascosto in modo che non vi siano indizi.

Steam (ST): Would claiming that a hidden door therefore exists, even though a detective couldn't find it, ...be anti-mystery?
Umineko Project (UP): Would claiming that hidden doors therefore necessarily exist even if the detective can't find them......be anti‐mystery?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Would claiming that a hidden door therefore exists even though a detective couldn't find it......be anti-mystery?
PC Japanese (JP): だから探偵に発見できずとも、隠し扉は必ず存在していると主張するのは、……アンチミステリー？
Russian (RU): Утверждение, что поэтому скрытая дверь есть, даже если детектив не смог её найти...... было бы анти‐детективом?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Alegar que portas secretas necessariamente podem existir mesmo se o detetive não conseguir encontrá‐las......seria antimistério?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，即便偵探發現不了，也要主張“必定存在著暗門”的，……是反推理劇？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，即便侦探发现不了，也要主张“必定存在着暗门”的，……是反推理剧？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Affermare quindi che un passaggio segreto esista nonostante un detective non sarebbe in grado di trovarlo... sarebbe anti-mystery?

Steam (ST): ...That's enough of that. This argument is too far of a digression from the riddles I'm actually supposed to be solving.
Umineko Project (UP): .........That's enough of that.{n}This argument is too far of a digression from the riddles I'm actually supposed to be solving.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........That's enough of that. This argument is too far of a digression from the riddles I'm actually supposed to be solving.

Umineko Project (UP): I'm only fighting to explain that it was possible for a {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} to carry out these crimes which were supposedly carried out by a witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm only fighting to explain how it was possible for a human to carry out these crimes which were supposedly carried out by a witch.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "It doesn't work for me. ...There's something strange about making it possible to deny the existence of all hidden doors without investigating. ...It's about as dubious as a Devil's Proof. ...Even though it's supposed to be the exact opposite of fantasy, it somehow feels like it's the same kind of argument."
Umineko Project (UP): "It doesn't work for me. ......There's something just wrong about making it possible to deny the existence of all hidden doors without investigating. ...It's about as dubious as a Devil's Proof. ......Even though it's supposed to be the exact opposite of fantasy, it somehow feels like it's the same kind of argument."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It doesn't work for me. ......There's something strange about making it possible to deny the existence of all hidden doors without investigating. ...It's about as dubious as a Devil's Proof. ......Even though it's supposed to be the exact opposite of fantasy, it somehow feels like it's the same kind of argument."
PC Japanese (JP): 「苦手だな。……隠し扉の存在を、調べもせずに全否定可能なんて、何だかおかしいぜ。…悪魔の証明並に胡散臭ぇな。……ファンタジーの対極のはずなのに、なぜか同じ論法になっちまってる気がするぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「苦手だな。……隠し扉の存在を、調べもせずに全否定可能なんて、何だかおかしいぜ。…悪魔の証明並に胡散臭ぇな。……ファンタジーの対極のはずなのに、なぜか同じ論法になっちまってる気がするぜ」
Russian (RU): "Он не для меня. ......Странно, что можно опровергнуть существование всех скрытых проходов без расследования. ...Примерно так же сомнительно, как доказательство дьявола. ......Эти заповеди должны опровергать фантастику, но у меня такое чувство, что они сами та же фантастика."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ela não serve pra mim. ......Tem algo simplesmente errado em fazer com que seja possível negar a existência de todas as portas secretas sem sequer investigar. ...É tão dúbio quanto a Prova Diabólica. ......Mesmo que supostamente seja o exato oposto da fantasia, eu meio que sinto que é o mesmo tipo de argumento."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「有點接受不了。……不用調查，就能完全否定掉暗門的存在，總覺得這不對勁啊。…跟惡魔的證明同一級別的扯。……感覺它明明跟幻想劇是在兩個極端，但又不知為何地成了同樣的邏輯。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「有点接受不了。……不用调查，就能完全否定掉暗门的存在，总觉得这不对劲啊。…跟恶魔的证明同一级别的扯。……感觉它明明跟幻想剧是在两个极端，但又不知为何地成了同样的逻辑。」

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "In detective novels, there's always a scene where the detective announces that he's discovered who the culprit is. ...That's a sign saying 'The hints have all been given in the previous parts of the story, so dear readers, please try to reason it out'."
Umineko Project (UP): "In detective novels, there's always a scene where the detective announces that he's discovered who the culprit is. ......That's a sign saying "The hints have all been given in the previous parts of the story, so dear readers, please try to reason it out"."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Em romances policiais, sempre tem uma cena onde o detetive anuncia que descobriu quem é o culpado. ......É um sinal que diz "As dicas foram todas concedidas previamente durante a história, por isso, meus queridos leitores, tentem deduzir"."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「在推理小說中，會有偵探宣言“明白犯人是誰了”的一幕吧。……這一幕也就是意味著，“在至此為止的文章中，記述著所有線索，諸位讀者，請進行推理吧”的信號喲。」

Que pequenas e espertas palavras possam ser usadas para esconder a sua própria incompetência.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): “汝等無能之輩一直憤慨地提出的停止思考的理由，是‘情報不足’！而給了汝等情報呢，這次又來了個懷疑情報真偽的‘否定根據’！還挺方便不是？將無能束之高閣，著實是句悅耳的言詞呢。”
Chinese Simplified (CN): “汝等无能之辈一直愤慨地提出的停止思考的理由，是‘情报不足’！而给了汝等情报呢，这次又来了个怀疑情报真伪的‘否定根据’！还挺方便不是？将无能束之高阁，着实是句悦耳的言词呢。”

Il motivo per cui ogni volta smetti di pensare e poi te ne lamenti è la ‘mancanza di informazioni’! Se poi ti vengono date delle informazioni, prendi a dubitare se queste informazioni siano veritiere o meno ‘rinnegandone i fondamenti’! Non è una bella situazione di comodo? Che paroline astute per nascondere la tua incompetenza!’

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "You seem to think the Knox Decalogue is a series of restrictions imposed by the one who made the {f:5:mystery}, but it is also vital for the {f:5:readers}. ...By using the Decalogue as a crutch, we are given the courage needed to use reasoning, as well as the willpower to reread the tale several times in search of the clues we know must be hidden {f:5:there}."
Umineko Project (UP): "The Knox Decalogue is often thought of as a series of restrictions imposed by the one who made the mystery, but it is also vital for the {f:5:readers}. .........By using the Decalogue as a crutch, we are given the courage needed to use reasoning, as well as the willpower to reread the tale several times...in search of the clues we know must be hidden {f:5:there}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You seem to think that the Knox Decalogue is a series of restrictions imposed by the one who made the MYSTERY, but it is also vital for the READERS. .........By using the Decalogue as a crutch, we are given the courage needed to use reasoning, as well as the willpower to reread the tale several times in search of the clues we know must be hidden THERE."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ノックス十戒は、ミステリーの出題者に課す制限と思われがちデスガ、読み手にとっても大切なものなのデス。………十戒を杖とすることで、私たちは、推理する勇気と、必ず隠されているに違いない手掛かりを求めて、何度も物語を読み返す気力を授かるのデス。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ノックス十戒は、ミステリーの出題者に課す制限と思われがちデスガ、読み手にとっても大切なものなのデス。………十戒を杖とすることで、私たちは、推理する勇気と、必ず隠されているに違いない手掛かりを求めて、何度も物語を読み返す気力を授かるのデス」
Russian (RU): "Ты, видимо, думаешь, что декалог Нокса — это ряд ограничений создателя детективного жанра, но он жизненно важен и для читателей. .........Опираясь на Декалог, мы обретаем храбрость, необходимую для рассуждений, а также силу воли перечитывать историю в поисках подсказок, которые должны быть там скрыты."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O Decálogo de Knox costuma ser visto como uma série de restrições impostas por aquele que elabora o mistério, mas é também vital para os {f:5:leitores}. .........Usando o Decálogo como suporte, nós damos a coragem necessária para raciocinar, bem como a força de vontade para reler a história diversas vezes...atrás de pistas que sabemos que ainda podem estar {f:5:escondidas}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「諾克斯十誡，雖被當成了約束推理劇出題者的限制，但它對於讀者也是很重要的。………有十誡當拐杖，我們能得到，去進行推理的勇氣，與為了找到必然隱藏著的線索，而一遍又一遍地重讀故事的毅力。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「诺克斯十诫，虽被当成了约束推理剧出题者的限制，但它对于读者也是很重要的。………有十诫当拐杖，我们能得到，去进行推理的勇气，与为了找到必然隐藏着的线索，而一遍又一遍地重读故事的毅力。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sembri convinto che il Decalogo di Knox sia una serie di restrizioni imposte da chi crea l'enigma, ma esso è anche essenziale per i LETTORI. ... Usando il Decalogo come supporto, ci viene conferito il coraggio necessario a ragionare, assieme alla forza di volontà necessaria a rileggere la storia più volte alla ricerca degli indizi che sappiamo devono esservi NASCOSTI."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...It's like the lid of a jar of jam that's too tight and won't open. ...Like Mom always used to say, ...if you think you can't open it, then it really won't open no matter how hard you try. ...The same thing happens in sports. They say whether or not you have a strong image of yourself and believe you can win no matter what... has a large impact on the records."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........It's like the lid of a jar of jam which is too tight and won't open. ......Like Mom always used to say, ......if you think you can't open it, then it really won't open no matter how hard you try. ......The same thing happens in sports. They say that whether or not you have a strong image of yourself and believe you can win no matter what...has a large impact on the records you set."

They say that whether or not you have a strong image of yourself and believe you can win no matter what has a large impact on the records."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………固くて開かない、ジャム瓶の蓋みたいだな。……母さんがよく言ってたぜ。……開かないと思ってると、いくら頑張っても開かないって。……スポーツにもそういうのあるよな。必ず自分は成し遂げられるという強いイメージがあるのとないのでは、記録に大きく差が出るというし。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………固くて開かない、ジャム瓶の蓋みたいだな。……母さんがよく言ってたぜ。……開かないと思ってると、いくら頑張っても開かないって。……スポーツにもそういうのあるよな。必ず自分は成し遂げられるという強いイメージがあるのとないのでは、記録に大きく差が出るというし」
Russian (RU): ".........Напоминает неоткрывающуюся банку варенья. ......Как мама всегда говорила...... если думаешь, что не можешь её открыть, она не откроется, как ни старайся. ......То же самое и в спорте. Говорят, вера в себя и в то, что победишь во что бы то ни стало, значительно влияет на результат."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........É como a tampa de um pote geleia que está muito apertado e não abre. ......Assim como minha mãe costumava dizer, ......se você achar que não vai abrir, então não vai abrir mesmo, não importa quanta força você use. ......A mesma coisa acontece nos esportes. Dizem que ter ou não uma forte imagem de si e acreditar que pode vencer a qualquer custo...possui um grande impacto nos recordes que você estabelece."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………就跟很緊擰不開的果醬瓶蓋一樣呢。……我媽媽常說，……想著擰不開的話，那不管怎麼努力都是擰不開的。……體育運動也是有這個情況的吧。據說，有沒有強烈地自我暗示“自己一定能做到”，所得出的成績是會有巨大的差距的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………就跟很紧拧不开的果酱瓶盖一样呢。……我妈妈常说，……想着拧不开的话，那不管怎么努力都是拧不开的。……体育运动也是有这个情况的吧。据说，有没有强烈地自我暗示“自己一定能做到”，所得出的成绩是会有巨大的差距的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... È come il coperchio di un barattolo di marmellata che è troppo stretto e non vuole aprirsi. ... Come Mamma diceva sempre... se sei convinto di non poterlo aprire, allora veramente non si aprirà, a dispetto di quanto ti possa impegnare. ... La stessa cosa succede negli sport. Dicono che l'avere o meno una buona immagine di sé e credere di poter vincere a prescindere da tutto abbia un grosso impatto sui risultati."

Steam (ST): In that case... ...The Knox Decalogue isn't really a set of arrogant and strict restrictions. ...You can also see it as a way to encourage readers, who are trying to solve the mystery, by telling them to give it their all, since it's definitely solvable...
Umineko Project (UP): In that case, the Knox Decalogue isn't really a set of arrogant and strict restrictions. ......You can also see it as a way to encourage readers, who are trying to solve the mystery, by telling them to give it their all since it's definitely solvable...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that case. The Knox Decalogue isn't really a set of arrogant and strict restrictions.......You can also see it as a way to encourage readers, who are trying to solve the mystery, by telling them to give it their all since it's definitely solvable...
PC Japanese (JP): だとするなら。ノックス十戒は、堅苦しい制限や傲慢ではなく。……推理に挑む者たちへの、必ず解けるから頑張れという、応援だとも受け取れるのだ…。
Russian (RU): В таком случае. Декалог Нокса вовсе не набор высокомерных и строгих ограничений. ......Можно рассматривать его как способ поощрить разгадывающих загадку читателей, говорящий им, чтобы они постарались, раз она, безусловно, разрешима...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse caso, o Decálogo de Knox não é um estabelecimento da arrogância e estritas restrições. ......Você também pode vê‐lo como uma forma de encorajar os leitores que estão tentando resolver o mistério, dizendo a eles para darem o máximo pois definitivamente é solucionável...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 照這麼說的話。諾克斯十誡，並非是死板的限制或傲慢。……而是能理解為，是送給挑戰推理的人們的，意為“肯定能解開的，加把勁”的鼓舞…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 照这么说的话。诺克斯十诫，并非是死板的限制或傲慢。……而是能理解为，是送给挑战推理的人们的，意为“肯定能解开的，加把劲”的鼓舞…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In tal caso. Il Decalogo di Knox non è davvero un insieme di restrizioni arroganti e severe. ... Lo si può anche vedere come un modo per incoraggiare i lettori, che stanno cercando di risolvere il giallo, dicendo loro di fare del proprio meglio dato che, senza alcun dubbio, è risolvibile...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...That's an interesting way to interpret it. ...Still, I've heard that not all detective novels around the world follow the Decalogue all the time, right? ...When you bump into one of those, won't you feel tricked...?"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........That's an interesting way to interpret it. ......However, I've heard that not all of the detective novels around the world follow the Decalogue all the time, right? .........When you bump into one of those, won't you feel tricked...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………面白い解釈だ。……しかし、世の中の推理小説全てが、必ず十戒を守ってるわけでもないと聞いたぜ？………そういう作品にぶち当たった時、騙されたーってことにはならないのかよ…？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………面白い解釈だ。……しかし、世の中の推理小説全てが、必ず十戒を守ってるわけでもないと聞いたぜ？　………そういう作品にぶち当たった時、騙されたーってことにはならないのかよ…？」
Russian (RU): ".........Интересное толкование. ......Но я слышал, что не все детективы в мире всегда следуют Декалогу. .........Разве не чувствуешь себя обманутым, когда натыкаешься на один из таких?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Essa é uma forma interessante de interpretá‐lo. ......Mas eu já ouvi que nem todo romance policial pelo mundo necessariamente segue o Decálogo. .........Não se sentiria traída se acabasse se deparando com um desses...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………是個有趣的解釋呢。……不過，據我聽說，世上的推理小說，可並不是全都必定遵守十誡的哦？………當撞到這一類作品時，難道不是成了被騙了嘛…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………是个有趣的解释呢。……不过，据我听说，世上的推理小说，可并不是全都必定遵守十诫的哦？………当撞到这一类作品时，难道不是成了被骗了嘛…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... È un'interpretazione interessante, questa. ... Però, ho sentito che non tutti i romanzi gialli al mondo seguono sempre il Decalogo, non è così? ... Se si dovesse incappare in uno di questi, non ci si sentirebbe come se ti avessero preso per i fondelli...?"

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "Even the Decalogue is nothing more than a single {f:5:interpretation}, and it cannot be applied to all mystery {f:5:stories}. ...Though among fundamentalists of my father's work, it seems there are those who harshly criticize works that violate the Decalogue and call them {f:5:heresy}..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Even the Decalogue is nothing more than a single interpretation, and it does not apply to all mystery {f:5:stories}. ......Though among fundamentalists of my father's work, it seems there are those who harshly criticize works which violate the Decalogue and call them {f:5:heresy}..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Even the Decalogue is nothing more than a single INTERPRETATION, and it does not apply to all mystery STORIES. ......Though among fundamentalists of my father's work, it seems there are those who harshly criticize works which violate the Decalogue and call them HERESY..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「十戒もまた、解釈のひとつに過ギズ、全てのミステリーに適応できるものではありマセン。……父の原理主義者の方々は、十戒を破った作品を異端と呼んで、激しく糾弾される方もいらっしゃるようデスガ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「十戒もまた、解釈のひとつに過ギズ、全てのミステリーに適応できるものではありマセン。……父の原理主義者の方々は、十戒を破った作品を異端と呼んで、激しく糾弾される方もいらっしゃるようデスガ…」
Russian (RU): "Даже Декалог не более чем одно из толкований, он не распространяется на все детективы. ......Хотя среди сторонников работ моего отца встречаются те, кто жестоко критикует работы, нарушающие Декалог, и называет их ересью..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mesmo o Decálogo não é mais do que uma simples interpretação, e não se aplica a todas as histórias de {f:5:mistério}. ......Dentre os fundamentalistas dos trabalhos do meu pai, parece haver aqueles que criticam duramente obras que violam o Decálogo e as chamam de {f:5:heresia}..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「十誡也無非只是一種解釋，並不適用於全部推理劇。……雖然父親的原教旨主義者們，將違反十誡的作品稱為異端，好像甚至有人遭受到了猛烈的抨擊…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「十诫也无非只是一种解释，并不适用于全部推理剧。……虽然父亲的原教旨主义者们，将违反十诫的作品称为异端，好像甚至有人遭受到了猛烈的抨击…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Lo stesso Decalogo non è altro che una singola interpretazione, e non vale per tutti i MYSTERY. ... Anche se tra i seguaci più fervidi dell'opera di mio Padre, pare ci siano coloro che criticano aspramente quelle opere che violano il Decalogo e le chiamano ERESIE..."

Umineko Project (UP): The same goes for the readers.

PC Japanese (JP): そして読者も。
Russian (RU): То же самое относится и к читателям.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O mesmo vale para os leitores.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而讀者也一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而读者也一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lo stesso vale per i lettori.

Steam (ST): Until they are assured that they will certainly be able to solve the riddle if they try, they don't want to read the story.
Umineko Project (UP): Until they are assured that they will definitely be able to solve the story if they try, they don't want to read it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Until they are assured that they will certainly be able to solve the riddle if they try, they don't want to read the story.
PC Japanese (JP): 作品に挑んだら、必ず推理できるという保証が得られるまで、作品を読みたくない。
Russian (RU): Без уверенности в том, что загадку абсолютно точно можно разгадать, они не хотят читать историю.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até terem certeza de que eles definitivamente serão capazes de resolver a história se tentarem, eles não querem lê‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讀者如若要挑戰，那在能得到“必定能推理”的保證前，不會想讀這部作品。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 读者如若要挑战，那在能得到“必定能推理”的保证前，不会想读这部作品。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fino a che non avranno la certezza che saranno sicuramente in grado di risolvere l'enigma se ci provano, non avranno voglia di leggere la storia.

Steam (ST): Because they don't want to write what they consider a masterpiece and be hurt when no one reads it.
Umineko Project (UP): Because they don't want to write what they consider a masterpiece and be hurt when no one reads it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because they don't want to write what they consider a masterpiece and be hurt when no one reads it.
PC Japanese (JP): 力作と思って執筆して、誰にも読まれずに傷つきたくないから。
Russian (RU): Одни не хотят писать то, что считают шедевром, и огорчаться, когда его никто не читает.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque não querem escrever uma obra‐prima e se ferirem quando ninguém a ler.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 作家是因為，不希望自認是傑作地執筆撰寫，結果卻誰都不讀地令自己受傷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 作家是因为，不希望自认是杰作地执笔撰写，结果却谁都不读地令自己受伤。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perché non vuole scrivere quel che considera un capolavoro e poi sentirsi ferito quando nessuno lo leggerà.

Steam (ST): Because they don't want to reason about what they consider a masterpiece and be hurt when they realize it was all useless.
Umineko Project (UP): Because they don't want to apply logic to what they consider a masterpiece and be hurt when they realize it was all useless.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because they don't want to reason about what they consider a masterpiece and be hurt when they realize it was all useless.
PC Japanese (JP): 力作と思って推理して、無駄だったと知り傷つきたくないから。
Russian (RU): Другие не хотят рассуждать о том, что считают шедевром, и огорчаться, понимая, что всё было напрасно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque não querem aplicar a lógica naquilo que consideram uma obra‐prima e se ferirem quando perceberem que é inútil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讀者是因為，不希望以為是傑作地用心推理，結果卻是白費勁地令自己受傷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 读者是因为，不希望以为是杰作地用心推理，结果却是白费劲地令自己受伤。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perché non vogliono riflettere su quel che considerano un capolavoro e poi sentirsi feriti quando capiranno che è stato tutto invano.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "By that argument, ...it really isn't a stretch to say it's like love between shy elementary or middle school-aged kids. ...Even though they really do want it, they don't have the courage to reveal their feelings, so they wait uncomfortably for the other person to confess, ...and by the time summer ends, nothing's happened."
Umineko Project (UP): "By that argument.........it really isn't a stretch to say it's like love between shy elementary or middle school‐aged kids. ......Even though they are interested, they don't have the courage to reveal their feelings, so they wait uncomfortably for the other person to confess......and by the time summer ends, nothing's happened."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "By that argument.........it really isn't a stretch to say it's like love between shy elementary or middle school-aged kids. ......Even though they really do want it, they don't have the courage to reveal their feelings, so they wait uncomfortably for the other person to confess......and by the time summer ends, nothing's happened."
PC Japanese (JP): 「その理論によると、………まさに奥手な、小学生、中学生の恋愛だな。……気があるくせに、打ち明ける勇気もなく、相手の告白を待って、もじもじしたまま何の進展もなく、……ひと夏が終わる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その理論によると、………まさに奥手な、小学生、中学生の恋愛だな。……気があるくせに、打ち明ける勇気もなく、相手の告白を待って、もじもじしたまま何の進展もなく、……ひと夏が終わる」
Russian (RU): "Тогда......... не будет преувеличением сказать, что это как любовь между застенчивыми детьми начальной или средней школы. ......Даже если они очень хотят, им не хватает смелости раскрыть свои чувства, поэтому они в тревоге ждут признания своей половинки...... а к концу лета так ничего и не происходит."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Seguindo esse argumento.........não chega a ser um exagero dizer que é como um romance entre tímidos alunos do fundamental ou ensino médio. ......Mesmo que digam que estão interessados, eles não têm coragem de revelar seus sentimentos, por isso esperam confortavelmente que outra pessoa confesse a eles......e assim o verão chega ao fim, e nada aconteceu."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「以這個理論來說的話，………那簡直就正是稚嫩的，小學生、中學生的戀愛啊。……明明有那意思，卻沒挑明的勇氣，光等著對方告白，在扭扭捏捏毫無進展之中，……結束了一個夏天。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「以这个理论来说的话，………那简直就正是稚嫩的，小学生、中学生的恋爱啊。……明明有那意思，却没挑明的勇气，光等着对方告白，在扭扭捏捏毫无进展之中，……结束了一个夏天。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Partendo da questi presupposti... dire che è come l'amore tra timidi ragazzini che frequentano le elementari o le scuole medie non è affatto un'esagerazione. ... Nonostante lo vogliano dal profondo del cuore, non hanno il coraggio di rivelare i propri sentimenti, per cui aspettano inquieti che sia l'altra persona a farsi avanti... e alla fine dell'estate, non è accaduto nulla."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Heh, more than that, sometimes the girl even ends up going out with an entirely different guy. That's what my first love was like, ihihi."
Umineko Project (UP): "Heheh, sometimes they'll even hook up with a different person. That's what my first love was like, ihihi."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Heheh, sometimes they'll even go out with a different person. That's what my first love was like, ihihi."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いやいや、他の男とくっ付いちまうことだってあるぜ。俺の初恋もそんな感じだったさ、いっひっひ。」

Russian (RU): "Хе‐хех, иногда они даже переключаются на другого. Такой была моя первая любовь, ихи‐хи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, às vezes a garota acaba ficando com outro cara. Assim que foi o meu primeiro amor, ihihi."

Steam (ST): Along with these one-sided feelings they can't express, they lament the passage of a summer that will never come again, and the days of their youth end.
Umineko Project (UP): Along with these one‐sided feelings they can't express, they lament the passage of a summer which will never come again, and the days of their youth end.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Along with these one-sided feelings they can't express, they lament the passage of a summer which will never come again, and the days of their youth end.
PC Japanese (JP): 打ち明けられぬ片思いは、二度と訪れぬ夏を後悔しながら、青春を、終わる。
Russian (RU): Наряду с невзаимными чувствами, которые они не могут выразить, они всё жалуются на промежуток лета, который никогда больше не наступит, и их юность подходит к концу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Junto a esses sentimentos unilaterais que não conseguem expressar, eles lamentam a passagem do verão que nunca mais voltará, e os dias de suas juventudes chegam ao fim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 無法告白心意的單戀者，將在對再也不會重來的那年夏天的後悔中，結束青春。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 无法告白心意的单恋者，将在对再也不会重来的那年夏天的后悔中，结束青春。

Steam (ST): The writer who wouldn't write until he gained the support of readers...goes for all eternity without releasing his maiden work.
Umineko Project (UP): The writer who wouldn't write until he gained the support of readers...goes for all eternity without releasing his maiden work.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The writer who wouldn't write until he gained the support of readers...goes for all eternity without releasing his maiden work.
PC Japanese (JP): 読者の支持が得られるまで執筆しない作家は、永遠に処女作を出さずに、終わる。
Russian (RU): Писатель, не пишущий, пока его не поддержат читатели, вовеки не выпустит свою первую работу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O autor que não escreve até obter o apoio dos leitores...passa toda a eternidade sem lançar o seu primeiro trabalho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在得到讀者的支持前不願動筆的作家，將永遠不會有處女作問世地就此結束。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在得到读者的支持前不愿动笔的作家，将永远不会有处女作问世地就此结束。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lo scrittore che non voleva scrivere prima di essersi guadagnato il supporto dei lettori... andrà avanti per sempre senza pubblicare il suo primo lavoro.

Steam (ST): The reader who waited for the writer's rise to fame...goes their whole life without knowing the joy of the mystery genre.
Umineko Project (UP): The reader who waited for the writer's rise to fame...goes their whole life without knowing the joy of the mystery genre.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The reader who waited for the writer's rise to fame...goes their whole life without knowing the joy of the mystery genre.
PC Japanese (JP): 作家の迎合を待つ読者は、生涯、ミステリーの楽しさを知ることなく、終わる。
Russian (RU): Читатель, ожидающий, пока писатель прославится, идёт по жизни, не зная прелестей детективного жанра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O leitor que espera até que o escritor alcance a fama...passa toda sua vida sem saber os prazeres dos romances policiais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 等待作家迎合的讀者，將一輩子不知推理劇的樂趣地就此結束。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 等待作家迎合的读者，将一辈子不知推理剧的乐趣地就此结束。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il lettore che aspettava che lo scrittore diventasse famoso... trascorrerà tutta la vita senza conoscere le gioie del genere mystery.

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "...Battler-kun, when does this "the chicken or the egg" type of shy love reach the level where can it progress into mutual love...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......Battler‐kun. When does this "the chicken or the egg" type of shy love...reach the level where it progresses into mutual love......?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Battler-kun. When does this 'the chicken or the egg' type of shy love reach the level where it progresses into mutual love......?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……戦人くん。その、卵が先か鶏が先か、という奥手な恋愛は、どの段階にまで進んだら、相思相愛の関係になるのですか……？」
Russian (RU): "......Баттлер. Когда эта 'дилемма курицы и яйца' переходит на уровень взаимной любви?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Battler‐kun. Quando esse tipo de amor tímido "o ovo ou a galinha"...alcança o nível de progredir em um amor mútuo......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……戰人君。這種“先有蛋還是先有雞”的稚嫩的戀愛，是要到哪個階段，才會發展成彼此相愛的關係呢……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……战人君。这种“先有蛋还是先有鸡”的稚嫩的恋爱，是要到哪个阶段，才会发展成彼此相爱的关系呢……？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Battler-kun. Quand'è che questo amore timido che assomiglia alla questione del ‘prima l'uovo o la gallina’... raggiunge il livello in cui si evolve in amore reciproco...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Well, ...that's probably when things start to pile up. ...It starts as a relationship between friends, they communicate with each other more and more, ...and when the two both reach the level where they're sure... that "I like this person and they surely like me", ...well, then they probably just naturally become a pair of lovers."
Umineko Project (UP): "Well, .........it's probably gradual over time. ...It starts as a relationship between friends, they communicate with each other more, ......and they start thinking "I like this person and I think they like me"......and when both of them reach the stage where they're no longer in doubt, then.........well, I guess...they probably just naturally become a couple."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Well, .........that's probably when things start to pile up. ...It starts as a relationship between friends, they communicate with each other more, ......and when the two both reach the level where they're sure...... that 'I like this person and they surely like me', ......well, then they probably just naturally become a pair of lovers."
PC Japanese (JP): 「それは、………積み重ねだろうな。…まず友達関係から始めて、コミュニケーションを増やし、……こいつはきっと俺のことが好きで、俺もこいつのことが好きだっ、と……、疑えなくなった段階を、二人が共有できたところでその、……まぁ、多分、自然と恋人関係に進めるんじゃないかと。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それは、………積み重ねだろうな。…まず友達関係から始めて、コミュニケーションを増やし、……こいつはきっと俺のことが好きで、俺もこいつのことが好きだっ、と……、疑えなくなった段階を、二人が共有できたところでその、……まぁ、多分、自然と恋人関係に進めるんじゃないかと」
Russian (RU): "Ну......... когда всё накапливается. ...Сначала двое дружат, общаются друг с другом всё больше...... а когда уже уверены...... И думают 'мне нравится этот человек, и я точно нравлюсь ему'......... ну, тогда они и становятся парой."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, .........deve ser gradual com o passar do tempo. ...Começa com uma relação de amizade, onde vão se comunicando cada vez mais um com o outro, ......e logo começam a pensar "Eu gosto dessa pessoa e acho que ela gosta de mim"......e quando ambos chegam no estágio onde eles não têm mais dúvidas, então.........bem, eu acho...que eles provavelmente se tornam um casal naturalmente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這個，………是要看積累吧。…首先從朋友關係開始，增進交流，……這傢伙一定喜歡我，並且我也喜歡這傢伙……，當到了兩人能共同不再對此抱有懷疑的階段，……多半，就能自然地發展成戀人關係了吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这个，………是要看积累吧。…首先从朋友关系开始，增进交流，……这家伙一定喜欢我，并且我也喜欢这家伙……，当到了两人能共同不再对此抱有怀疑的阶段，……多半，就能自然地发展成恋人关系了吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Beh... probabilmente quando la situazione si fa più complessa. ... Inizia come il rapporto tra due amici, i due comunicano di più tra loro... e quando entrambi raggiungono il livello in cui sono sicuri... che ‘questa persona mi piace e di certo io piaccio a lei’... beh, probabilmente a quel punto diventano automaticamente una coppia di amanti."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "My impression up until now was that relationships starting with a sudden confession of love tend to break up more often, whereas pairs who never actually confess to each other but realize that they've always been together...usually stay together for a surprisingly long time."
Umineko Project (UP): "The impression I've gotten so far is that relationships which start with a sudden confession of love tend to break up more often, whereas couples who never actually confess to each other but realize that they've always been together usually stay together for a surprisingly long time."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "My impression up until now is that relationships which start with a sudden confession of love tend to break up more often, whereas pairs who never actually confess to each other but realize that they've always been together usually stay together for a surprisingly long time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「唐突な告白で始まった関係は、割と別れることも多いが、実は互いに告白したことがなく、気付いたらずっと一緒にいたって連中の方が、案外、付き合いは長いってのが、俺の今日までの印象だ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「唐突な告白で始まった関係は、割と別れることも多いが、実は互いに告白したことがなく、気付いたらずっと一緒にいたって連中の方が、案外、付き合いは長いってのが、俺の今日までの印象だ」
Russian (RU): "У меня сложилось впечатление, что отношения, которые начинаются с внезапного признания в любви, распадаются гораздо чаще, в то время как пары, которые никак друг другу не признаются, но понимают, что всегда будут вместе, обычно остаются друг с другом на удивление долго."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A impressão que eu tinha até então é que uma relação que começa com uma confissão de amor repentina tende a se romper mais do que as outras, do que casais que nunca se confessaram de verdade um para o outro, mas perceberam que sempre estiveram juntos por um período de tempo surpreendente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「以唐突的告白而開始的關係，相較而言分手的也多，其實依我一直以來的印象，彼此都沒有告白，等意識到時就已經一直在一起了的傢伙，反倒是會交往很久。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「以唐突的告白而开始的关系，相较而言分手的也多，其实依我一直以来的印象，彼此都没有告白，等意识到时就已经一直在一起了的家伙，反倒是会交往很久。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "L'impressione che ho ricevuto finora è che le relazioni che iniziano con una dichiarazione d'amore improvvisa tendono a finire più spesso, mentre invece coppie che non si dichiarano mai ma si accorgono di essere sempre state insieme, di solito restano insieme per un lasso di tempo incredibilmente lungo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "In that case, ...that means the culprit in all of these repeating games... is one of the 18. From the very beginning, ...there was no need for an illusion of a 19th person."
Umineko Project (UP): "In that case, .........that means the culprit in all of these repeating games...is one of the 18 people. From the very beginning......there was no need for an illusion of a 19th person."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「なら、………何度も繰り返されたこのゲームの犯人は全て、…１８人の中の誰かだってことになる。１９人目の幻想なんて、……始めから必要ない」

Umineko Project (UP): ......then because this tale is solvable, it features no elements which are impossible to explain with logic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Then because this tale is solvable, no elements will appear which make it impossible to solve.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......então, por ser um conto solucionável, ela não contém elementos que seriam impossíveis de se explicar com a lógica.

Steam (ST): When they do appear, I shouldn't suspect that the mystery element is breaking down, ...but I should instead question why it was shown...and suspect the witnesses and observers.
Umineko Project (UP): When it does appear, I shouldn't suspect that the mystery element is breaking down, ......but I should instead question why it was shown and suspect the witnesses and observers.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When they do appear, I shouldn't suspect that the mystery element is breaking down, ......but I should instead question why it was shown and suspect the witnesses and observers.
PC Japanese (JP): それが登場した時点で、ミステリーの破綻を疑うのではなく、……どうしてそれが描写されてしまうのか、目撃者や観測者を疑うべきなのだ。
Russian (RU): Когда она появляется, не нужно подозревать, что элемент детектива рушится. ......Я должен вместо этого задаться вопросом, почему это было показано, и поставить под подозрение свидетелей и наблюдателей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando ela aparecer, eu não devo suspeitar que os elementos do mistério entraram em colapso, ......mas, ao invés disso, eu devo questionar o motivo pelo qual estão sendo mostrados e suspeitar de testemunhas e observadores.

Umineko Project (UP): Depictions of magic that have no place in a mystery.

Steam (ST): By showing me that, she forced me to think that this tale wasn't a mystery, and therefore, that reasoning was impossible... So I surrendered...
Umineko Project (UP): By showing me that, she forced me to think that this tale wasn't a mystery, and therefore, that reasoning was impossible, ...and I surrendered......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By showing me that, she forced me to think that this tale wasn't a mystery, and therefore, that reasoning was impossible...and I surrendered......

Umineko Project (UP): However, if I had believed unshakably that it was a mystery...

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Also, at the end of the 1st game, it was revealed that this tale was passed on to people in the future by that message bottle.

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, ......this entire story is a world which includes the personal opinions of an observer, namely, the person who wrote that message in a bottle.

Steam (ST): By the end of the 1st game, it was already clear that we've broken the constant premise of the mystery genre: that the story itself must be seen through the eyes of God.
Umineko Project (UP): By the end of the first game, it had already been made clear that the text violated a constant premise of mystery stories: that they must be told from a God's‐eye view.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By the end of the 1st game, it had already been made clear that we've broken the constant premise of the mystery genre: that the story itself must be seen through the eyes of God.
PC Japanese (JP): ミステリーでお約束とされている、本文は神の目線でなければならないとする前提が破られていることが、第１のゲームの時点で、……もうはっきりと明記されている。
Russian (RU): К концу первой игры уже стало ясно, что постоянная предпосылка детективного жанра нарушена. Сама история должна быть рассмотрена глазами Бога.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao fim do primeiro jogo, foi deixado claro que o texto violava uma premissa constante das histórias de mistério: elas devem ser contadas da perspectiva do olhar de deus.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在第 1 盤遊戲時，……就已經清楚表明了，推理劇中約定俗成的，“本文必須以神的視點來記述”的前提，被打破了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在第 1 盘游戏时，……就已经清楚表明了，推理剧中约定俗成的，“本文必须以神的视点来记述”的前提，被打破了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Alla fine del primo gioco, era stato già reso chiaro che la premessa costante di tutto il genere mystery era stata infranta: la storia stessa deve essere vista attraverso gli occhi di Dio.

Steam (ST): For that reason, it's possible to doubt even the observer, as well as the witnesses.
Umineko Project (UP): For that reason, it's possible to doubt not just the witnesses, but the observer as well.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For that reason, it's possible to doubt even the observer, as well as the witnesses.
PC Japanese (JP): だからこそ、目撃者と同時に、観測者もまた、疑うことが可能なのだ。
Russian (RU): Значит, сомневаться можно как в свидетелях, так и в наблюдателе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, é possível duvidar das testemunhas, bem como o próprio observador.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，在可以懷疑目擊者的同時，也可以懷疑觀測者。

Steam (ST): However, that begs the question: ...is it even possible to solve a tale written by an observer who isn't impartial?

Speaker: Gertrude
Steam (ST): "Allow me to speak. Knox's 8th. It is forbidden for the case to be resolved with clues that are not presented."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim, para fazer com que eu recuperasse minha vontade de lutar, ......do terceiro jogo em diante, ela preparou as coisas de maneira que ficassem mais fáceis para mim, me dando dicas sobre como lutar e algumas pistas.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "{p:2:It is possible that it was just a sheet or something fluttering in the wind and rain which you mistook for Kinzo. It cannot be used as foreshadowing to form a basis for Knox's 9th...!! Mistaking things for something else is a right permitted to all observers!!}"
PC Japanese (JP): 「{p:2:それは風雨になびくシートか何かを、あなたが誤認しただけの可能性がありマス。ノックス第９条を示す伏線とはなり得まセン…！！誤認は全ての観測者に許された権利デス！！}」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「{p:2:それは風雨になびくシートか何かを、あなたが誤認しただけの可能性がありマス。ノックス第９条を示す伏線とはなり得まセン…！！　誤認は全ての観測者に許された権利デス！！}」
Russian (RU): "{p:2:Вполне возможно, что за Кинзо ты принял простынь, развивающуюся на ветру. Это не предпосылка, создающая основу для 9‐го Нокса!.. Ошибаться разрешено всем наблюдателям}!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{p:2:É possível que fosse apenas um lençol ou algo mais flutuando em meio ao vento e a chuva, e você confundiu isso com Kinzo. Não pode ser usado como prenúncio para formar uma base para o Knox 9º...!! Confundir coisas é um direito permitido a todos os observadores}!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「{p:2:你有可能僅僅是把隨風雨飄動的防水布什麼的錯看成了金藏。這不能算諾克斯第 9 條的伏筆…！！誤認是所有觀測者都獲准的權力！！}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「{p:2:你有可能仅仅是把随风雨飘动的防水布什么的错看成了金藏。这不能算诺克斯第 9 条的伏笔…！！误认是所有观测者都获准的权力！！}」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "{p:2:È possibile che fosse solo un lenzuolo o qualcosa che si agitava nel vento e nella pioggia, che tu hai scambiato per KINZO.} {p:2:Non può essere usato come indizio per formare una base per Knox NONO...!!} {p:2:Scambiare cose per qualcos'altro è un diritto concesso a tutti gli OSSERVATORI!!}"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "{p:1:There's the red truth which Beato showed during the fourth game!! No person would mistake Ushiromiya Kinzo by sight}!"
Umineko Project (UP): "{p:1:There's the red truth which Beato showed during the fourth game!! No person would mistake Ushiromiya Kinzo by sight}!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "{p:1:There's the red truth which Beato showed during the 4th game!! No person would mistake Ushiromiya Kinzo by sight!}"
PC Japanese (JP): 「{p:1:第４のゲームにてベアトが示した赤き真実！！全ての人物は右代宮金蔵を見間違わないッ！}」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「{p:1:第４のゲームにてベアトが示した赤き真実！！　全ての人物は右代宮金蔵を見間違わないッ！}」
Russian (RU): "{p:1:Есть красная правда Беато из четвёртой игры! Никто бы не спутал Уширомию Кинзо с чем‐либо другим}!"

Steam (ST): It's the red truth Beato used to counter my blue truth claim that "someone disguised themselves as Kinzo" to make it seem as though Grandfather had appeared.
Umineko Project (UP): It's the red truth Beato used to counter my blue truth claim that someone disguised themselves as Grandfather...and thereby made it seem as though he had appeared.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It's the red truth Beato used to counter my blue truth claim that 'someone disguised themselves as Kinzo' to make it seem as though Grandfather had appeared.
PC Japanese (JP): かつての俺の青き真実、“何者かが祖父さまに変装”して、祖父さまが現れたかのように偽装したと主張した際の、ベアトの反論の赤き真実だ。
Russian (RU): Эту красную правду Беато противопоставила моей синей правде о том, что 'кто‐то замаскировался под Кинзо', чтобы создать такое впечатление, будто дед появился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Essa foi a verdade vermelha que a Beato usou para contra‐atacar minha verdade azul que alegava que alguém estava se disfarçando de vovô...e assim teria feito parecer que ele havia aparecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是以前，我以藍色真實“某人變裝成了爺爺”，主張有人假扮爺爺現身時，貝阿朵反駁的紅色真實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是以前，我以蓝色真实“某人变装成了爷爷”，主张有人假扮爷爷现身时，贝阿朵反驳的红色真实。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È la verità rossa che Beato ha usato per contrattaccare la mia verità blu che affermava che ‘qualcuno si era travestito come Kinzo’ per far sembrare che il Nonno fosse apparso.

Steam (ST): {p:1:In other words, on this island, anything which might lead someone to visually mistake something for Grandfather, including someone else pretending to be Grandfather, {i:cannot ever work}.}
Umineko Project (UP): {p:1:In other words, on this island, anything which might lead someone to visually mistake something for Grandfather, including someone else pretending to be Grandfather, {i:cannot ever work}.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {p:1:In other words, on this island, all illusions which might lead someone to mistake something for Grandfather, including someone else pretending to be Grandfather, 'most certainly cannot work'.
PC Japanese (JP): {p:1:　つまり、この島では、祖父さまのふりはもちろん、祖父さまに見間違うような一切の現象は、“絶対に通用しないのだ”。}
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): {p:1:つまり、この島では、祖父さまのふりはもちろん、祖父さまに見間違うような一切の現象は、“絶対に通用しないのだ”。}
Russian (RU): {p:1:Иначе говоря, на этом острове все иллюзии, по вине которых можно принять что‐то за деда, включая то, что кто‐то другой им притворился, *не действуют*.}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {p:1:Ou seja, nesta ilha, qualquer coisa que possa levar alguém a visualizar por engano algo como sendo o vovô, incluindo alguém fingindo ser o vovô, {i:jamais pode funcionar}.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {p:1:這即是指，在這個島上，假扮成爺爺當然不用說，一切能令人將別的什麼看錯成爺爺的現象，都是“絕對不管用的”。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {p:1:这即是指，在这个岛上，假扮成爷爷当然不用说，一切能令人将别的什么看错成爷爷的现象，都是“绝对不管用的”。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {p:1:In altre parole, su quest'isola, tutte le illusioni che possono portare qualcuno a scambiare qualcosa per il Nonno, incluso qualcun altro che fa finta di essere il Nonno, ‘certamente non possono funzionare’. }

Steam (ST): All of Aunt Natsuhi's schemes to make it seem Grandfather existed were hidden in the relatives' blind spots, all of them clever tricks like "he was here just a second ago" or "he's in his study alone now".
Umineko Project (UP): The scheme Aunt Natsuhi once put together to make it seem as though Grandfather was alive...only involved her saying things like "he was here just a second ago" or "he's in his study alone now", cleverly exploiting the relatives' blind spots to pretend he was there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All of Natsuhi oba-san's schemes to make it seem that Grandfather existed were hidden in the relatives' blind spots, all of them clever tricks like 'he was here just a second ago' or 'he's in his study alone now'.
PC Japanese (JP): かつて夏妃伯母さんが工作した、祖父さまが生存しているフリは、常に親族たちの死角に匿い、ついさっきまでここにいた、あるいは今は一人で書斎にいる、等として、巧みに居るフリをして誤魔化したものだ。
Russian (RU): Все схемы тёти Нацухи, создающие впечатление, что дед жив, были скрыты в слепых зонах родственников. Все их ловкие трюки вроде 'он секунду назад был здесь' или 'он сейчас у себя кабинете'.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O plano da tia Natsuhi de fazer parecer que o vovô estava vivo...envolveu apenas ela dizendo coisas como "ele estava aqui um segundo atrás" ou "ele está sozinho em seu estúdio agora", explorando habilmente os pontos cegos dos parentes para fingir que ele estava lá.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以前夏妃伯母所假造的，爺爺還活著的假象是，每時每刻都藏匿在親族們的死角，以“剛才還在這”，或“現在一個人在書房”等等的形式，巧妙地裝出了“就在家裡”的樣子，搪塞蒙混。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以前夏妃伯母所假造的，爷爷还活着的假象是，每时每刻都藏匿在亲族们的死角，以“刚才还在这”，或“现在一个人在书房”等等的形式，巧妙地装出了“就在家里”的样子，搪塞蒙混。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tutti le disposizioni di Natsuhi oba-san per far sembrare che il Nonno esisteva erano nascoste nei punti ciechi dei parenti, tutti trucchetti astuti come ‘era qui fino ad un secondo fa’... o ‘è da solo nel suo studio ora’.

Steam (ST): They never tried to make anyone mistake something they saw for Grandfather himself, so there are no contradictions.
Umineko Project (UP): She never tried to make anyone mistake something they saw for Grandfather himself, so there are no contradictions.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They never tried to make anyone mistake something they saw for Grandfather himself, so there are no contradictions.
PC Japanese (JP): 祖父さまと見間違えるような、何かの工作をしたわけではないから、これとは矛盾しない。
Russian (RU): Они не пытались сделать так, чтобы кто‐либо спутал что‐то увиденное с самим дедом, так что никаких противоречий нет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela nunca fez ninguém confundir algo como se tivesse visto o vovô em pessoa, logo não há contradições.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她並沒有做令人把什麼看錯成爺爺的手腳，所以與這紅字並不矛盾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她并没有做令人把什么看错成爷爷的手脚，所以与这红字并不矛盾。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non hanno mai provato a far scambiare per il Nonno stesso qualcosa che gli altri hanno visto, quindi non ci sono contraddizioni.

Steam (ST): If they had tried to dress one of the servants in Grandfather's robe, ...it probably would've been seen through in an instant...
Umineko Project (UP): If she had tried to dress one of the servants in Grandfather's robe...it would probably have been seen through in an instant......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If they had tried to dress one of the servants in Grandfather's robe... it would probably have been seen through in an instant......

Russian (RU): Если бы они набросили на кого‐то из слуг накидку деда... их бы мгновенно раскрыли......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ela tivesse tentando vestir um dos serviçais com o manto do vovô...isso provavelmente seria desmascarado no mesmo instante......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果，她叫了某個傭人穿上爺爺的長袍什麼的話…，那就會在轉瞬之間被看穿吧……。

Umineko Project (UP): It has been guaranteed that none of the characters in this tale...would "mistake something for Grandfather by sight"...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It has been guaranteed that none of the characters in this tale would 'mistake something for Grandfather by sight'...!

Russian (RU): Было гарантировано, что ни один из персонажей в этой истории 'не может перепутать деда с чем‐либо другим'!..

Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个故事的全体人物，绝对不会“把别的什么错看成爷爷”的这一点，是受到保证的…！

Umineko Project (UP): If someone still claims to have seen Grandfather, it becomes a "falsehood".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If someone still claims to have seen Grandfather, it becomes a 'falsehood'.

Umineko Project (UP): Everyone is permitted the right to falsify their observations......but there is one person who does not have that right.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos possuem o direito de falsificar suas observações......mas há uma pessoa que não tem esse direito.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然虚假的观测是谁都有的权力，……但有一个人不能这样。

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "...So, once you claimed to have seen Kinzo, it was no longer misrecognition, but {f:5:intentional}. ...In other words, this proves that the observer was not {f:5:objective}... Is what you are {f:5:saying}...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......So, once you claimed to have seen Kinzo, it was no longer misrecognition...but {f:5:intentional}. ......In other words, this disproves the objectivity of your viewpoint......is what you are {f:5:saying}......?"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……金蔵を見たと主張された時点で、誤認識ではなく、意図的。……即ち、観測の客観性が否定されていることの証、…というわけデスカ……」
Russian (RU): "......Значит, ты сказал, что видел Кинзо, не предполагая, а намеренно. ......И это доказывает, что наблюдатель не был объективен... Вот что ты имеешь в виду?.."

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……只要主張看到了金藏，就不是誤認，而是有意的。……換言之，就是觀測的客觀性遭到否定的、…證據嗎……？」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Quindi, una volta che hai affermato di aver visto Kinzo, non era più misconoscimento... ma era INTENZIONALE. ... In altre parole, questo prova che l'osservatore non era oggettivo... è questo ciò che stai DICENDO...?"

Steam (ST): In this case, unintentional "misrecognition" is not permitted by the rules of this game. However, it is possible to intentionally "lie about seeing" something you never saw...!!
Umineko Project (UP): In this case, unintentional {i:misrecognition} is not permitted by the rules of this game.{n}However, it is possible to intentionally {i:lie about seeing} something you never saw...!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In this case, unintentional 'misrecognition' is not permitted by the rules of this game. However, it is possible to intentionally 'lie about seeing' something you never saw...!!
PC Japanese (JP): 無意識に“見間違えること”は、ゲーム上、許されていない。しかし、意識的に、見てもいないモノを“見たと騙ること”は出来る…！！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 無意識に“見間違えること”は、ゲーム上、許されていない。{n}しかし、意識的に、見てもいないモノを“見たと騙ること”は出来る…！！
Russian (RU): В этом случае непреднамеренное неузнавание недопустимо правилами игры.{n}Но можно намеренно 'солгать об увиденном', о том, чего никогда не видел!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Neste caso, {i:erro de reconhecimento} não intencional não é permitido pelas regras deste jogo.{n}Porém, é possível {i:mentir sobre ter visto} intencionalmente sobre algo que você nunca viu...!!
